channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U of Mississippi opens probe over hostile protest that involved racist taunts
item.description: Videos of Thursday's incident at the school were shared on social media showing heated confrontations between pro-Palestinian protesters and a larger group of counterprotesters.
item.content:encoded:
Videos of Thursday's incident at the school were shared on social media showing heated confrontations between pro-Palestinian protesters and a larger group of counterprotesters.

(Image credit: Rogelio V. Solis)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Hamas says latest cease-fire talks have ended. Israel vows a military operation soon
item.description: The latest round of Gaza cease-fire talks ended in Cairo. Meanwhile, Israel closed its main crossing point for delivering badly needed humanitarian aid for Gaza after Hamas attacked it.
item.content:encoded:
The latest round of Gaza cease-fire talks ended in Cairo. Meanwhile, Israel closed its main crossing point for delivering badly needed humanitarian aid for Gaza after Hamas attacked it.

(Image credit: Tsafrir Abayov)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Bernard Hill, who starred in 'Titanic' and 'The Lord of the Rings,' dies at 79
item.description: The English actor played Captain Edward John Smith in the 1997 film Titanic as well as King Théoden of Rohan in The Lord of the Rings trilogy.
item.content:encoded:
The English actor played Captain Edward John Smith in the 1997 film Titanic as well as King Théoden of Rohan in The Lord of the Rings trilogy.

(Image credit: Joel Ryan)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Israel raids Al Jazeera office as Netanyahu government votes to shut channel down
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that his government voted unanimously to shut down the local offices of Qatar-owned broadcaster Al Jazeera.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that his government voted unanimously to shut down the local offices of Qatar-owned broadcaster Al Jazeera.

(Image credit: Abir Sultan)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Ni

item.title: The original 'Harry Potter' book cover art is expected to break records at auction
item.description: Sotheby's June 26 auction of Thomas Taylor's watercolor illustration for Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is estimated to sell for $400,000-$600,000.
item.content:encoded:
Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (1997) is expected to break auction records at Sotheby's on June 26.'/>

Sotheby's June 26 auction of Thomas Taylor's watercolor illustration for Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is estimated to sell for $400,000-$600,000.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy calls God an "ally" against Russia in Orthodox Easter message
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged Ukrainians in an Easter address to be united in prayer and called God an "ally" in the war with Russia.
item.content:encoded:
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged Ukrainians in an Easter address to be united in prayer and called God an "ally" in the war with Russia.

(Image credit: Francisco Seco)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Bodies found in Mexico likely those of missing American and two Australians
item.description: Three bodies recovered in an area of Mexico's Baja California state are likely to be those of two Australians and an American who went missing last weekend during a camping trip, officials said.
item.content:encoded: Three bodies recovered in an area of Mexico's Baja California state are likely to be those of two Australians and an American who went missing last weekend during a camping trip, officials said.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: When rockets fall, Bedouin Israeli citizens have nowhere to hide
item.description: While most buildings in Israel are required to have bomb shelters, a zoning catch-22 has left Bedouin villagers unprotected.
item.content:encoded:
While most buildings in Israel are required to have bomb shelters, a zoning catch-22 has left Bedouin villagers unprotected.

(Image credit: Ahmad Gharabli)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Driver dies after crashing into White House perimeter gate, Secret Service says
item.description: A driver died after a vehicle crashed into a gate at the White House Saturday night, but the fatal collision is being investigated "only as a traffic crash", law enforcement authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A driver died after a vehicle crashed into a gate at the White House Saturday night, but the fatal collision is being investigated "only as a traffic crash", law enforcement authorities said.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Mystik Dan wins the Kentucky Derby by a nose
item.description: In a close finish, Mystik Dan won the 150th running of the race on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
In a close finish, Mystik Dan won the 150th running of the race on Saturday.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
